pageContext.claim: “They want to nullify your ballots, poison our democracy and overthrow the entire system of government.”
pageContext.analysis: The Constitution allows the House to impeach the president for “high crimes and misdemeanors,” but that’s not the same as nullifying an election or an overthrow of government. The Senate holds a trial in impeachment cases, and a two-thirds majority is needed to convict and remove an officeholder. If Trump were removed, Vice President Pence would be first in line to assume the presidency.
